experience: You and Larry both know Lauretta (Laurie) Zerga, Raoul Encinas, and 22 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Larry worked at Charles Schwab before you started
Provide planning, risk assessment and mitigation, and implementation services for Epic systems and supporting infrastructure.

Current Projects includeDeveloping use cases for cloud environmentsSAP Print Infrastructure in a hosted environmentCloud printing solutions - testing and feature analysisMedical system including 3D imagingPrint TCO assessment and RFP/RFQ development

Responsible for distributed print and scan applications, developing solutions for Mainframe, Unix, and Windows systems.Designed and implemented an external vendor print distribution system, utilizing VPN connections to deliver output to distributed printers, archives, and an online report viewer.Designed and implemented all printing solutions for the introduction of Schwab Bank, including branch operations, back office, and external partnersProvided senior management with metrics for print TCO, including support and development costs.  Reduced number of print/copy/fax devices in the environment by over 35% by performing output device rationalization and installation of multifunction devices.Developed print security solutions for check printing, network print security, and offshore printing to minimize risk to firm.Developed highly available Windows print solutions using clustered servers.Evaluated and implemented a high speed color variable data print solution with Kodak Nexpress.

Managed five product managers and eight application engineers for US division of international printer OEM.  Directly responsible for worldwide product management for line matrix printers.Led laser team to develop custom solution for California DMV, replacing serial matrix printers.Led search for Multifunction device source, determined opportunities to add value, performed business analysis of potential partners. Prepared pricing and coordinated international product launch.Defined product requirements and international launch plan for 1800 lpm line matrix printer.Performed sales and technical training with internal sales force and resellers.

General Manager for a connectivity and graphics company specializing in IBM mainframe and midrange connectivity solutions.  Responsible for P+L, company direction, and OEM sales.Grew revenue by 300% by obtaining OEM contracts to supply IBM, Tally, Printronix, and Printek with connectivity solutions for coax and twinax.  Later versions included Ethernet interfaces for Novell and Windows.Determined market for graphics printing controller (IBM IPDS), managed team of engineers to develop a multiprocessor solution sold to several printer OEMsManaged manufacturing expansion to implement leading edge surface mount technology needed for two sided mixed mode circuit board solutions

summary: IT professional with extensive experience in designing and implementing application, printing, scanning, and workflow products and solutions. Managed product lines globally to deliver value to multiple channels.  Proven expertise in using multiple research methods to obtain the clearly defined requirements necessary for cost effective products and solutions.  Broad background includes business management and technology provides the multiple viewpoints resulting in optimum solutions.  Innovative use of web services to deploy and deliver infrastructure and data.Specialties: Print related security including VPNs, firewalls, storage, encryption, access controls.Connectivity solutions both hardware and OS (Mainframe, AS400,UNIX,TCP/IP, local.Driver configurations for both 32/64 bit Universal drivers, custom drivers for direct printer control.Creation of RFPs, RFQs, Product requirement documents and SOWs, product owner for Agile developments.Determine optimum solution for products or users based on technical and business requirements derived from use cases.
